page.title: 08Belper Lane End(2)
page.content: The{Bull's Head Inn}was bought by the Spencers, a Derbyshire farming family,for Â£76,000 from Bass. The inn is listed in 1794 as a stopping place for coaches on the London to Wirksworth Rd. There is a London milestone on the{Gorses.}Itwas a turnpike and used to have a toll.The front room used to be a blacksmiths and there are marks on the beams of the horseshoes.It was bought by George Offiler in 1882 for Â£620 from a farmer and Bass bought it in 1961. There was a cottage at the top of{ {Jesses Lane}and there was a carrier who lived with his dog. One day the dog died because it was always chained to the wheel of the cart.The dog now haunts the lane and it can be heard walking and rattling its chain down Jesses Lane.
